alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Central Marion; Eastern Alachua; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Bradford, southeastern Alachua, northwestern Marion, northwestern Putnam and southwestern Clay Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 344 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of George`s Lake to 8 miles west of Sparr. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Interlachen, Melrose, Citra, Hawthorne, George`s Lake, Lake Geneva, Florahome, Melrose Landing, Cross Creek and Micanopy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Central Marion; Eastern Alachua; Western Marion
